definitions.definition: The outer protective layer of the body of any animal, including of a human.
definitions.example: He is so disgusting he makes my skin crawl.

definitions.definition: The outer protective layer of the fruit of a plant.
The skin and fur of an individual animal used by humans for clothing, upholstery, etc.
A congealed layer on the surface of a liquid.
definitions.example: In order to get to the rest of the paint in the can, you′ll have to remove the skin floating on top of it.

definitions.definition: A set of resources that modifies the appearance and/or layout of the graphical user interface of a computer program.
definitions.example: You can use this skin to change how the browser looks.

definitions.definition: An alternate appearance (texture map or geometry) for a character model in a video game.
Rolling paper for cigarettes.
A subgroup of Australian aboriginal people; such divisions are cultural and not related to an individual′s physical skin.
Bare flesh, particularly bare breasts.
definitions.example: Let me see a bit of skin.

definitions.definition: A vessel made of skin, used for holding liquids.
That part of a sail, when furled, which remains on the outside and covers the whole.
The covering, as of planking or iron plates, outside the framing, forming the sides and bottom of a vessel; the shell; also, a lining inside the framing.
A drink of whisky served hot.
Person, chap
definitions.example: He was a decent old skin.

definitions.definition: To injure the skin of.
To remove the skin and/or fur of an animal or a human.
To high five.
To apply a skin to (a computer program).
definitions.example: Can I skin the application to put the picture of my cat on it?

definitions.definition: To use tricks to go past a defender.
To become covered with skin.
To cover with skin, or as if with skin; hence, to cover superficially.
To produce, in recitation, examination, etc., the work of another for one's own, or to use cribs, memoranda, etc., which are prohibited.
To strip of money or property; to cheat.
Someone with a shaved head.
Member of the skinhead subculture arising in late 1960s England or its diaspora, often incorrectly associated with violence and white-supremacist or anti-immigrant principles.
